meanings.definition: Resembling dough in texture or consistency.
meanings.sent1: The bread was so doughy that it felt like squeezing a cloud.
meanings.sent2: Her skin looked doughy after applying moisturizer.
meanings.sent3: The doughy pillow was so soft, it felt like sleeping on a marshmallow.
meanings.sent4: The doughy clay was easy to mold into different shapes.
meanings.sent5: The doughy playdough was irresistible to the children.

meanings.definition: Having the appearance or texture of dough.
meanings.sent1: The cake had a doughy texture that melted in the mouth.
meanings.sent2: His face turned doughy with fear when he saw the ghost.
meanings.sent3: The doughy clouds in the sky looked like giant marshmallows.
meanings.sent4: Her doughy hands were covered in flour from baking.
meanings.sent5: The doughy pizza crust was the best part of the meal.

meanings.sent1: The doughy fabric of the blanket was comforting on cold nights.
meanings.sent2: His doughy cheeks were pinchable and rosy.
meanings.sent3: The doughy clay was perfect for sculpting tiny animals.
meanings.sent4: Her doughy doughnuts were a hit at the bake sale.
meanings.sent5: The doughy playdough squished between her fingers as she molded it.
